data.approach: Create comprehensive documentation in CLAUDE.md explaining the new IDE-driven agent registration workflow: 1) Name generation via JS word lists, 2) Direct SQLite insertion, 3) Session identity file creation. Compare with legacy am-register approach and provide examples.

summary: Added comprehensive documentation section in ide/CLAUDE.md
Documented the 6-step agent registration flow via /api/work/spawn
Explained name generation using 72Ã—72 word list combinations
Added comparison table: Legacy am-register vs New IDE Spawn approach
Included API reference with request/response examples
Added guidance for agent developers implementing /jat:start
findings: New approach eliminates need for agents to call am-register
Name collision checking supports up to 5,184 unique combinations
Pre-session identity files enable hook-based agent lookup
Task assignment now happens at IDE level, not agent level
recommendedActions: Consider updating /jat:start command docs to reference new registration flow

summary: Updated documentation on new agent registration workflow via /api/work/spawn
Documented name generation method and SQLite database insertion process
Explained session identity file creation steps
Clarified replacement of previous am-register approach

suggestedTasks.title: Create Comprehensive API Documentation for Agent Registration
suggestedTasks.description: Develop a detailed, step-by-step technical specification for the new agent registration process. Include sequence diagrams, API endpoint details, authentication flow, and error handling mechanisms. Focus on creating a clear reference for developers implementing or integrating with the new registration system.
suggestedTasks.reason: Current documentation needs more technical depth and clarity

suggestedTasks.title: Implement Unit Tests for Agent Registration Workflow
suggestedTasks.description: Design and implement comprehensive unit tests covering various scenarios of the new agent registration process. Test edge cases including name generation, database insertion, session file creation, and potential error conditions. Ensure full coverage of the registration logic in the spawn API.
suggestedTasks.reason: No existing tests were mentioned for the new registration mechanism

patterns: SQLite database insertion for agent sessions
gotchas: Replacement of previous am-register approach requires careful migration

documentationNeeds: Migration guide from am-register to new registration process
